title: What is the logic of removing public access to cctv and web telecast of electorial process
selftext: I came across this news in a shock. Isn't it a threat to the transparency of electorial process.
comments: Russia style democracy at work.  Move on.

Transparency? Wait till there is only one option on the ballot. 

Revolution!!!

>What is the logic of removing public access to cctv and web telecast of electorial process 

What is the logic of having elections when everyone knows that Supreme Leader is the most popular leader?
So that elections like chadigarh can be easily repeated

>Wait till there is only one option on the ballot

That happened in a couple of constituencies recently, IIRC.

Better thing to say would be: "Wait till when the opponent falls out of a window the day before the election" or "Wait till when the opponent dies because of poisoning in a cafe just before the election".
Tab ghapla karna easy hoga simple
Move on to where? No choice whatsoever.
27% fake votes registered in some booths lately..
Just testing waters, level is very low but still need to identify the alligators.

So that when one's caught cheating it's not openly available  for public consumption ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

https://preview.redd.it/5qtd3eb7qx8e1.jpeg?width=706&format=pjpg&auto=webp&s=33c2687d21cffd047c4de00299ecee1d5dd0b2c4

According to an article in IE, the video was never available but the ambiguity in the wordings of the rule meant that people came asking around for it. The amendment just specifies that it is not available.   
Tldr: nothing new only specified the ground reality.
